summary: I. Charles Mathews is identified as an individual whose payroll records are documented within the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) files. The documents specifically mention staff payroll records related to I. Charles Mathews, indicating that he was an employee of the HSCA. The payroll records include forms related to salary adjustments, employment verification requests, and payroll authorizations. The documents suggest his involvement with the HSCA occurred around 1977.
significance: The significance of I. Charles Mathews lies in his association with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), which investigated the JFK assassination. His payroll records are part of the broader collection of HSCA staff records, which are subject to review and potential redaction to protect personal privacy. The documents provide insight into the staffing and administrative operations of the HSCA during its investigation.
